Alice.Action: Tenderly caresses Dan's back after making scratches, shares a loving moment and kiss with him.
Tries to clear the drain and turn off the shower despite increasing danger, pounds on the glass in desperation.
Cautiously explores the dark corridor and multiple doors, showing carefulness and fear but no interaction with others.
Notices the water rising and attempts to clear the drain.
Tries to turn off the shower but the handles come off in her hands.
Attempts to open the shower door but it won't budge, then pounds on the glass in desperation.
After escaping the water, cautiously explores the dark corridor and multiple doors, showing awareness and caution.
Looks down at herself, notices her nurse uniform and name tag, and starts moving toward the closing iron door while trying to stop it.
Turns and tries to escape when confronted by maniacs, shows fear but no aggression or hostility.
Screams in terror when surrounded and attacked, indicating vulnerability and sincerity in her emotional response.
Realizes the door she came through is gone and quickly moves toward the bolted steel door, attempting to escape.
Stops when maniacs block her way and does not attempt to fight or find an alternative escape route, instead becoming surrounded and terrified.
Screams as maniacs drag her down, showing fear and lack of control in the situation.
Wakes up immediately from the nightmare, indicating awareness and responsiveness to danger.
Pushes Englund away with every ounce of her strength, tries to sit up and escape.
Looks around in panic, tries to collect herself after a terrifying dream, shows vulnerability and sincerity.
Reluctantly starts to remove her robe and take a shower despite apprehension, showing self-care and resilience.
Pushes Englund away with every ounce of her strength and starts to sit up despite being pinned down.
Looks around in panic and reflexively glances toward the open window after waking up terrified.
Tries to collect herself and shakily climbs from bed, showing hesitation and distress.
Reluctantly starts to remove her robe and enter the shower despite apprehension.
Turns toward Greta and Yvonne and joins them, showing recognition and connection despite feeling a little glum.
Joins in the group rap and tries to be cheerful despite not feeling fully engaged.
Halfheartedly joins laughter and is a step behind the others' good spirits.
Responds to Yvonne's teasing about Dan with a smile and good-natured comment.
Tries to cheer up the group with a playful joke about Greta's gown.
Joins in the group rap despite not feeling enthusiastic, tries to be cheerful and smile.
Halfheartedly joins laughter, about a step behind others' good spirits.
Playfully teases Greta about God's message, laughs with friends, joins in lighthearted banter.
Encourages Greta to give up on Mark's advances in a friendly manner.
Jokes about psoriasis along with others, contributing to group laughter.
Asks Mark about his sketchbook and shows interest in his work.
Greets Mr. Grey politely and says 'Good to see you again, Mr. Grey.'
Puts on a cheerful face but internally feels on edge, indicating sincerity beneath social politeness.
Startled by Dan's bear hug and reacts with surprise but quickly recovers and reciprocates affection.
Tries to be enthusiastic about Dan's gift but fails to mask her true feelings.
Engages politely with Mark and Mr. Grey, showing social awareness and attempts to maintain a positive atmosphere.
Quickly leaves the awkward situation with Mr. Grey, indicating emotional self-regulation and situational awareness.
Hides her true anxious feelings behind a cheerful facade, showing emotional control but also internal stress.
Startled by Dan's sudden bear hug, showing a momentary lapse in alertness.
Recovers quickly from being startled and responds warmly to Dan, demonstrating social skill and emotional resilience.
Tries to be enthusiastic about the airplane tickets but fails to convincingly show excitement, indicating some difficulty in masking true feelings.
Shares her fears and insecurities about losing control and having bad dreams with Dan.
Responds sincerely and appreciatively to Dan's reassurance and affection.
Admits to feeling scared and out of control due to a recurring bad dream, but acknowledges reassurance and tries to accept it.
Hesitates to share her true feelings initially, showing some emotional vulnerability and lack of immediate openness.
Calmly tells Dan 'It's okay' when his parents move away, showing tolerance and understanding.
Shakes her head to refuse having a party at her place due to her dad's rules, showing respect for family boundaries but not pushing others away.
Joins in playful shoving of Mark after his crude comment, sharing in group humor and camaraderie.
Remembers she has to work tonight, responsibly prioritizing obligations over socializing.
Politely defuses tension with Dan by saying 'It's okay, Dan' when his parents are unfriendly.
Shakes her head to refuse having a party at her house due to her dad's rules about drinking.
Joins in the playful shove of Mark into the fountain, showing social confidence and quick wit.
Suddenly remembers she has to work tonight, interrupting the fun plans.
Tells friends to go ahead and she'll catch up later, indicating consideration for others' time and plans.
Looks unhappy and talks to herself with self-deprecating sarcasm, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Smiles warmly and expresses gladness to see her father despite his gruffness, showing tolerance and friendliness.
Engages in a somewhat tense but honest conversation with her father about his past and current behavior, showing trust and openness.
Reacts with delight and gratitude to a gift from her father, showing appreciation and positive emotional response.
Glances at her watch and looks around for someone, showing awareness of time and surroundings.
Tells others to go ahead and that she'll catch up later, indicating some independence and decision-making.
Trudges along staring at the ground, unhappy, showing emotional distraction and lack of engagement.
Engages in a brief, awkward but meaningful conversation with her father, showing emotional intelligence and social awareness.
Stares lovingly at her dad, kisses him on the cheek, takes his arm and leads him to take a picture with others.
Thanks her dad sincerely for everything and waves goodbye warmly.
Expresses disregard for others' opinions by telling her dad 'I don't give a damn what they might think. You're terrific.'
Takes the initiative to lead her father to take a picture, showing decisiveness and social confidence.
Handles social interactions smoothly, such as giving her camera to someone off screen and managing group photo arrangements.
Confidently asserts her feelings to her father, disregarding others' opinions.
Walks alone down an empty street at dusk, potentially showing poor judgment or lack of caution.
Faces ominous and threatening children alone, shows resolve to confront the danger rather than flee.
Recognizes ominous signs and hardens her resolve to confront the threat.
Closes her eyes tightly to focus and then opens them again, showing mental preparation.
Moves with increasing speed and determination into a dangerous, foreboding environment despite physical discomfort and injury.
Runs blindly through branches that tear at her clothing and face, showing some recklessness or desperation.
Stares with intrigue at the silhouetted nun and hurries after her, calling out 'Wait!'
Moves slowly and watchfully through a deserted, ominous hospital convent, showing caution and concern.
Hurries after the silhouetted nun up the gothic steps and pursues into the asylum despite the ominous setting.
Moves slowly and watchfully down a deserted, dark corridor, showing caution and awareness of danger.
Pauses and looks inside a room upon hearing a strange animal sound, then recoils with shock at the bloody sheep.
Runs past the stroller towards the nun, showing concern and urgency.
Looks around horrified and confused in the delivery room, indicating vulnerability but no negative behavior.
Sits bolt upright and shouts 'No!!!!' in response to the doctor, showing assertiveness and resistance to harm.
Notices the ominous pram and the nun, reacts quickly by running after the nun and moving up the staircase to follow.
Turns to look down the stairs and then back up, taking a step forward despite the eerie situation.
Is suddenly yanked down and loses control, ending up on a gurney being pushed by an orderly, showing vulnerability and lack of control in this moment.
Sits bolt upright and shouts 'No!!!!' in response to the doctor's instructions, showing assertiveness and refusal to comply blindly.
Looks horrified and confused in the delivery room, indicating uncertainty and fear in a critical situation.
Watches the chaotic and terrifying birth scene attentively, trying to understand Amanda's words and the situation.
Remains passive and does not intervene or take action during the panic caused by the newborn creature escaping.
Moves slowly and deliberately toward the double doors despite fear, takes a deep breath and opens them, showing determination and courage.
Stops and stares at Freddy's remains with horror, indicating a moment of vulnerability and recognition of past trauma.
Desperately tries to stop Freddy's resurrection despite being powerless.
Runs toward the altar to stop Freddy's resurrection despite the danger.
Desperately tries to crawl uphill through dust and smoke but is powerless to prevent the resurrection.
Struggles but cannot reach the altar and doubts her ability to stop Freddy even if she did.
Backs away from Freddy, frightened but angry; tries to keep distance and defends herself by striking out reflexively.
Raises herself up off the floor and looks around, showing awareness of her surroundings.
Backs away from Freddy, frightened and angry, but attempts to keep distance and confront him verbally.
Reflexively strikes out at Freddy when he steps closer, but he vanishes, indicating a reactive but not fully effective response.
Follows Freddy's laughter with frightened eyes, searching for him, showing alertness and vigilance.
Runs toward Amanda and tries to follow her through the doors despite them slamming shut, showing determination and trust in Amanda's guidance.
Feels disturbed and frightened when confronted by Anne, indicating vulnerability and sincerity in her emotional state.
Starts to move quickly toward Amanda and runs toward her, showing urgency and willingness to act.
Struggles to open the big doors when they slam shut, perseveres to get through.
Checks the diner environment by feeling the counter and furniture to confirm reality, showing awareness and critical thinking.
Appears puzzled, freaked out, and disturbed after entering the diner, showing emotional vulnerability and confusion.
Expresses relief and concern upon seeing Anne, indicating she values her presence.
Stands stunned and silent after Anne angrily leaves, showing passivity and possible lack of confrontation or explanation.
Is stunned and confused about the time, fails to realize she is hours late to the party, and does not respond effectively to Anne's anger.
Attempts to reach out by picking up the telephone after Anne leaves, indicating some initiative to communicate or resolve the situation.
Talks on the telephone trying to remain calm, admits fear and seeks help.
Talks on the telephone trying to remain calm despite being scared and dealing with a frightening situation.
Expresses fear openly and admits being scared.
No direct action or involvement in this excerpt; others take initiative while Alice is only called out.
Pours coffee for a late night customer, showing responsibility and normal social interaction.
Responds immediately and with concern to Dan's distress by running toward the wall and reaching out to him.
Experiences pain and distress but fights through it to run toward the burning truck, showing determination and care.
Hears Dan's voice and immediately reacts by running toward the wall and then out into the street despite intense pain, showing quick responsiveness and determination.
Drops the pot of coffee due to being startled and overwhelmed by the sudden hallucination, indicating a momentary loss of control.
Looks past the truck driver to Dan's mangled body, tries to get to him, shows emotional distress and collapse.
Quietly repeats 'It was him' after waking in hospital, indicating trust in her perception and concern for others.
Shakes her head and states 'It was no accident' in a monotone, showing determination and seriousness but no hostility or coldness.
Remains focused and aware enough to identify the true cause of the accident despite trauma and shock.
Collapses from shock and injury, losing consciousness after witnessing the traumatic event.
Clutches Yvonne in a desperate embrace while crying, showing vulnerability and seeking comfort.
Expresses concern for her friends' safety and insists on taking action against Krueger.
Dismisses the idea that Dan's death was an accident, showing distrust toward others' explanations.
Recognizes that Krueger is responsible for Dan's death and insists on the threat continuing, showing awareness and insight.
Becomes increasingly hysterical and struggles to control her emotions in front of others.
Challenges the assumptions of others (e.g., Dan didn't drink, so the champagne bottle fragments are suspicious), demonstrating critical thinking.
Asks questions about her own mental state and the meaning of Dr. Moore's comments, showing confusion and vulnerability.
Smiles and greets Jacob, a strange boy watching her silently.
Lies back, closes eyes tightly, sheds a tear, appears stunned and troubled, showing emotional vulnerability and difficulty processing the situation.
Responds tentatively and politely to Jacob, showing openness and calmness despite the eerie situation.
Shows concern for Jacob, tries to comfort him after learning about her boyfriend's death.
Calls after Jacob to not leave, indicating care and connection.
Shares her observations and worries about Jacob with Yvonne, showing openness and trust.
Persistently questions the reality of Jacob's presence despite others' skepticism, showing sincerity and emotional investment.
Questions Jacob about being in the hospital corridor and shows concern for him.
Tries to follow up on Jacob after he disappears, showing persistence.
Is puzzled and confused when Yvonne denies the existence of the boy and the children's ward, but continues to think about it.
Accepts Yvonne's vague and hesitant responses without pressing further or seeking more concrete answers.
Paces and speaks animatedly about Amanda Krueger's background, indicating active engagement and effort to understand the situation.
Explains the tragic history of Freddy Krueger and expresses guilt over Dan's death, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Angrily cuts off others trying to change the subject, showing impatience and intolerance.
Glares adamantly when contradicted, indicating defensiveness and unwillingness to listen.
Explains the backstory of Freddy Krueger clearly and confidently to others.
Takes responsibility for Dan's death, showing self-awareness and accountability.
Angrily cuts off others to redirect the conversation, showing assertiveness but possibly impatience.

Expresses fear and vulnerability about the threat in her dreams, showing openness about her feelings.
Allows friends to comfort and support her, indicating trust and acceptance of their care.

Engages in light teasing with her father about his shopping, indicating a warm, familiar relationship.
Hugs her father after their conversation, demonstrating affection and warmth.
Clearly communicates the seriousness of the supernatural threat and admits uncertainty about what will happen next.
Shows emotional vulnerability by tearing up and covering her tears, indicating internal struggle but still continues with daily tasks.
Engages in light, somewhat sarcastic banter with her father, showing social awareness and ability to maintain normal interactions despite stress.

Stands frozen in open-mouthed shock when Greta first appears, showing initial hesitation.

Steps closer to Mark despite his hostile tone, showing empathy and persistence in trying to communicate.

Expresses frustration and confusion about the situation, indicating some lack of understanding.
Puts a comforting hand on Mark's shoulder and offers to stay with him for a while.
Expresses frustration and confusion about the situation, openly admits not understanding how Krueger is attacking while awake.

Comforts Mark by putting an arm around his shoulder and speaks with certainty about their situation.
Offers to make coffee and share important information, showing initiative and readiness to communicate.
Notices Mark is missing and looks for him, demonstrating attentiveness and concern.

Freezes and stares at Jacob with a mixture of compassion and wariness.

Freezes momentarily upon seeing Jacob, indicating a brief hesitation or uncertainty.

Initially confused and stunned by Jacob's accusations and feelings of rejection, but quickly tries to reassure him she cares.
Chases after Jacob when he runs into danger, showing concern and protective instincts.
Shows instinctive motherly concern and attempts to comfort Jacob, tries to reason with him and lead him away from danger.

Expresses deep concern for her unborn baby and urgency to protect it from harm.

Appears panicked and wide-eyed in terror, showing emotional distress and vulnerability.

Gets angry and defensive when her friend suggests she leave to protect herself and the baby.
Tells Yvonne that running away won't help because Freddy finds you in your dreams, showing concern and realism.
Nods and helps Mark pick up scattered clippings after Yvonne storms out, showing cooperation and calmness.
Expresses determination to stop Freddy by understanding his method, showing responsibility and care for others.
Rejects Mark's suggestion to not have the baby despite the danger, valuing the baby as her last link with Dan, showing emotional sincerity and attachment.

Expresses determination to stop Krueger by understanding how he operates using Jacob's dreams, indicating insight and proactive thinking.
Considers Mark's suggestion to not have the baby to stop Krueger but decisively rejects it based on personal values, showing thoughtful decision-making.

Defends herself and her baby firmly against Mrs. Jordan's threats, showing emotional strength and assertiveness.

Relies on Mark to find information and does not independently verify facts.

Ponders seriously about how to deal with the threat, showing responsibility and determination.

Quickly regains composure after being startled by Freddy.

Immediately checks on Yvonne's wellbeing and plans next steps to find Amanda, indicating responsibility and forward planning.
Clutches her belly in pain and reacts with distress upon seeing Mark's death in the dream.

Clutches her belly in pain and reacts emotionally to Mark's death, showing vulnerability but no immediate action.
Shows concern for others by realizing the danger Krueger poses and insists on saving Amanda before it's too late.

Insists on going to the asylum to find Amanda's body, showing concern and urgency.

Kisses her father on the cheek before going upstairs, expressing affection and sincerity.
Insists on going to the asylum to find the body despite her father's objections.
Reluctantly gives in to her father's demand to go home and get some sleep, appearing frustrated but compliant.
Shouts defiantly at Freddy, showing determination to protect Jacob and confront evil.
Threatens Freddy and uses harsh language (e.g., 'you bastard!').
Shouts defiantly at Freddy, showing grim determination and awareness of his plans.
Actively searches the asylum corridors and heads toward the tower room, taking initiative to confront Freddy.
Halts and glares around suspiciously, showing alertness and caution.
Calls out to Amanda Krueger loudly, showing concern and connection to her sister.
Taunts Freddy by calling him a coward, using aggressive language.
Charges toward Freddy screaming, confronting danger head-on to protect or fight back.

Rushes down stairs and charges around corners confidently, showing quick decision-making and boldness.

Gazes down in victory and says 'Goodnight, asshole.' after Freddy is torn apart.
Closes her eyes, relieved but not wanting to see Freddy being torn apart.

Screams and reacts with revulsion when spiders land on her, then quickly removes her jacket and stamps on it to get rid of them.
Reassures Jacob by telling him Freddy won't hurt him and that he needs them both; encourages Jacob to come downstairs and go home.
Dread rising inside her, she nonetheless leaves the asylum and steps into the Escher maze, confronting a confusing and dangerous environment.
Reassures Jacob calmly despite Freddy's threatening presence, encouraging him to come downstairs and showing confidence in handling the situation.
Does not hesitate or flee when faced with Freddy and the surreal maze, instead moves forward with purpose.
Shouts to warn Jacob that Dan is not his father, trying to protect him from danger.
Recognizes the danger disguised as Dan and shouts a warning to Jacob, preventing him from being caught.
Picks up Jacob and runs to protect him from Freddy.
Looks at Jacob in amazement and listens to his explanation.
Shows determination to confront Freddy and protect herself and others.
Stares at Freddy in disgust and terror as he emerges from her face.

Looks around carefully for Freddy when he disappears, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Listens thoughtfully to Jacob's explanation and shows determination to confront Freddy, indicating intelligence and resolve.

Loses the fight with Freddy and sinks to the ground exhausted and beaten.
Rushed to pick up the new baby Jacob and cradled him tenderly in her arms.
